API Documentation

Welcome to the API documentation for the SquirrelUno project. This section provides a comprehensive guide to the project’s codebase, detailing each class and method to help you understand and use them effectively. Whether you’re contributing to the project or looking to extend its functionality, this documentation is designed to support your development needs.

Overview

The SquirrelUno project is structured to facilitate easy understanding and extension. The core functionality is divided across several modules, each responsible for different aspects of the game. This documentation covers the primary entry points and key components of the project.

Console Entry Point

The console entry point, defined in __main__.py, handles the command-line interface (CLI) for SquirrelUno. This module allows users to interact with the game through various commands and options.

Entry point for the uno package to run from Console

class uno.__main__.CLI[source]

Bases: object

Command Line Interface for the Uno package.

handle_no_command(args)[source]

Handle the case where no command is provided.

Parameters:

args – Parsed arguments

parse_args()[source]

Parse the command line arguments.

Returns:

Parsed arguments

run()[source]

Execute the appropriate function based on the parsed arguments.

version_info(args)[source]

Display version information.

Parameters:

args – Parsed arguments

Script Entry

The script entry point, defined in __init__.py, initializes the SquirrelUno package and contains the main logic for starting the game. This module ensures that all necessary components are correctly set up and ready to use.

Entry point for the game and definitions for various classes.

class uno.Card(color, value)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a card in the Uno game.

It has all base interactions for a card.

color

The color of the card (e.g., red, yellow, green, blue).

Type:

str

value

The value or number of the card.

Type:

str

class uno.GameMaster[source]

Bases: object

A class responsible for managing the Uno game.

players

The players in the game.

Type:

list of Player

deck

The deck of cards used in the game.

Type:

list of Card

add_player(player)[source]

Adds a player to the game.

Parameters:

player (Player) – The player to add to the game. :noindex:

create_deck()[source]

Creates a standard Uno deck. :noindex:

shuffle_deck()[source]

Shuffles the deck of cards. :noindex:

class uno.JokerCard(value)[source]

Bases: Card

A card with special events for the game.

This class represents special cards like ‘Wild’ and ‘Wild Draw Four’.

class uno.NumCard(color, number)[source]

Bases: Card

The basic colored number card for Uno.

Inherits from Card and represents a standard number card in the game.

class uno.Player(name)[source]

Bases: UIDObj

A class representing a player in the Uno game.

Inherits from UIDObj to provide a unique identifier for each player.

name

The name of the player.

Type:

str

hand

The cards held by the player.

Type:

list of Card

draw_card(card)[source]

Adds a card to the player’s hand.

Parameters:

card (Card) – The card to add to the hand. :noindex:

show_hand()[source]

Displays the cards in the player’s hand.

Returns:

A string representation of the cards in the player’s hand. :noindex:

Return type:

str

class uno.UIDObj[source]

Bases: object

A class used to generate and store a unique 8-character alphanumeric UID.

uid

Read-only property that returns the unique 8-character alphanumeric UID. :noindex:

Type:

str

property uid

Read-only property that returns the unique 8-character alphanumeric UID.

Returns:

The unique 8-character alphanumeric UID. :noindex:

Return type:

str

Entry point for the SquirrelUno project. :noindex:

Using This Documentation

Each module’s documentation includes a detailed list of members (functions, classes, methods) and their descriptions. Inheritance diagrams are provided where applicable to illustrate the class hierarchy and relationships.

Key sections: - Members: Lists all public members of the module. - Undocumented Members: Highlights any members without documentation, encouraging contributions to improve coverage. - Inheritance: Shows the inheritance structure of classes, helping you understand the architecture of the project.

For further assistance or to contribute to this documentation, please refer to the [Contribution Guidelines](contributing.html).

Feedback

We value your feedback to improve this documentation. If you find any discrepancies or have suggestions for enhancement, please reach out via our [issue tracker](https://github.com/MarvGMBH/SquirrelUno/issues).

Thank you for using SquirrelUno!
